Topic.Title: I TOLD YOU IDIOTS IBM WOULD DROP BACK DOWN!!!!!

Message.Msg: Link to that post on IBM board when you said this??

Sure looked that way in AH trading after Apple reported.. Looks like since then people have got back to their senses.. At 7:06 A.M.. Showing Dow futures up 65 pts.. Looks like the fact the Fed's are getting ready to add stimulas, is going to win out over Apple!! Big deal, Apple missed this qtr, while getting ready to hit mkt with new products... Personally, I think that speaks well for IBM.. They beat earnings est, but missed revenue target, due to turmoil in Europe, and the dollar being strong and losing on currency conversions... But as they up guidance for rest of yr... Makes me believe, it won't be long before IBM is back over $200.

Topic.Title: You should have sold before the close

Message.Msg: What a bunch of idiots do in after hours.. Don't have anything to do with what rational people do.. All I know is IBM closed at $190.34 yesterday, regardless of what CNBC is showing.. And Dow futures at 7:39 AM are up 82 pts... IBM could open at $192.???

Message.Title: More shares buyback in <3 months
Message.Msg: IBM announced in April they would implement another shares buyback program in October, it is a good strategy to take advantage of this low interest rate environment to further raise earnings per share by buying back more shares.

Topic.Title: I TOLD YOU IDIOTS IBM WOULD DROP BACK DOWN!!!!!

Message.Msg: When your message is deleted I cannot search on your name to find it. When you link to it I can see it, and saying someone is on crack and postng all the time in all CAPS makes you a troll. :/

Seeking Alpha on July 16th posted an extensive analysis of various scenarios questioning the value of buyback programs by a Jeff Paul. I don't agree with the conclusions but you may find it informative. It seems to me the question comes down to, is the price of your own stock based on it's earnings outlook too cheap. If it is, it's no different than if you used the money to buy another company's stock. I think IBM's stock purchases have proved to have been a good investment in their own company. Any company's management has a far better understanding of their own company than a different one. If the puprose of a buy back is simply to prop up the stock price, then it's a negative, and that sometimes is the case, but not with IBM regardless of the bashers comments. WW

Message.Title: Fed announces QE 3 after GDP report on Friday morning?
Message.Msg: is being rumored. 3% to 6% stock market move up if true.
"Nice." Many prefer IBM's $3.40. It's going up.

Wix , just like the debate over minimum wages , buybacks have compelling arguments on both sides ... as you commented , though , buying back to prop up price is a losers' game .. that being said , every share that IBM buysback either retires or receives as it's own income , 3.40 / share or 1.8% at today's price ... not a bad deal at all ... too bad that IBM doesn't actually retire more of the shares repurchased .... also , what would benefit the stock more .. buybacks ? or dividend boosts ?? ... the jury is out and each investor will have their own perspective on the matter .. bottom line fact ... it is not wise to bet against a winner .... IBM is a juggernaut and will be around long after many other companies will flame out (AAPL ? that heyday is a about done , in my book) .. remember when MSFT was going to take over the world ??? pretty tight 10 yr range on that one , eh ??? i would posit that by the time earning are at 20/sh , the dive will be around 6 bucks ... buy and IBM CD today and rates will rise while you hold it .. lol ... i wonder what happens when IBM unveils the air recharged battery .. should be in another 3 years .... i will posit that over the next 5 years , we are going to see IBM in businesses never considered for the company in the past .... later ... garce
